definitions.definition: the direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun rises at the equinoxes, on the right-hand side of a person facing north, or the point on the horizon itself.
examples: a gale was blowing from the east

definitions.definition: the compass point corresponding to this.
the eastern part of the world or of a specified country, region, or town.
examples: a factory in the east of the city

definitions.definition: the regions or countries lying to the east of Europe, especially China, Japan, and India.
examples: singular proper noun: East; noun: the East

definitions.definition: the eastern part of the US from the Alleghenies on the west and north of the Mason–Dixon line.
the former communist states of eastern Europe.
the player sitting to the left of North and partnering West.
lying toward, near, or facing the east.
(of a wind) blowing from the east.
examples: eastern, easterly, eastward, oriental an east wind

definitions.definition: situated in the part of a church containing the altar or high altar, usually the actual east.
of or denoting the eastern part of a specified area, city, or country or its inhabitants.

examples: traveling east, he met two men
